citations.narrative:
The “Cat Barn” houses cats. Most of the cats have free access to the entire space inside the structure and the “Cat Barn”
serves as the cats’ primary enclosure. There was a spray bottle of Simple Green cleaner hanging next to one of the
elevated resting surfaces and a cat bed was located on top of the resting surface.
Per this Section, primary enclosures must be maintained so that they protect the cats from injury. Simple Green is an all-
purpose cleaning product that should not be kept out in a space that serves as the cats’ primary enclosure. Cleaning
products may cause irritation to animals from contact with the fur/feet/skin or if ingested during self-grooming/licking. This
item was immediately corrected during the inspection by putting the spray bottle into a closed cabinet. To remain
corrected from this date 7/17/25 forward.

Dog #487 was examined by a veterinarian on 3/25/25 for an eye condition. Oral and topical medications were prescribed
and the eye condition subsequently resolved. The Licensee kept a daily record of the dates that the prescribed
medications were administered but they discarded the record after the treatment was completed and did not retain a copy.
Per this Section, exhibitors must keep copies of medical records for dogs and if a problem is identified (such as a disease,
injury, or illness), the medical records must include the names of all treatments administered and the dates of
administration of the treatments. Medical records document the medical care provided to the dogs and are reviewed at
the time of an inspection to assess compliance with the AWA Regulations and Standards. Correct from this date 7/17/25
forward by maintaining a copy of the records kept that document the dates and names of medications administered to the
dogs.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.
*END OF REPORT*
n

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The “Cat Barn” houses cats. Most of the cats have free access to the entire space inside the structure and the “Cat Barn” 
serves as the cats’ primary enclosure. There was a spray bottle of Simple Green cleaner hanging next to one of the 
elevated resting surfaces and a cat bed was located on top of the resting surface. 
 
Per this Section, primary enclosures must be maintained so that they protect the cats from injury. Simple Green is an all-
purpose cleaning product that should not be kept out in a space that serves as the cats’ primary enclosure. Cleaning 
products may cause irritation to animals from contact with the fur/feet/skin or if ingested during self-grooming/licking. This 
item was immediately corrected during the inspection by putting the spray bottle into a closed cabinet. To remain 
corrected from this date 7/17/25 forward. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Dog #487 was examined by a veterinarian on 3/25/25 for an eye condition. Oral and topical medications were prescribed 
and the eye condition subsequently resolved. The Licensee kept a daily record of the dates that the prescribed 
medications were administered but they discarded the record after the treatment was completed and did not retain a copy.  
 
Per this Section, exhibitors must keep copies of medical records for dogs and if a problem is identified (such as a disease, 
injury, or illness), the medical records must include the names of all treatments administered and the dates of 
administration of the treatments. Medical records document the medical care provided to the dogs and are reviewed at 
the time of an inspection to assess compliance with the AWA Regulations and Standards. Correct from this date 7/17/25 
forward by maintaining a copy of the records kept that document the dates and names of medications administered to the 
dogs. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative. 
 
*END OF REPORT*

n
